overview: This subject examines the law governing the registration, regulation and termination of corporations in Australia. It will explore a range of theoretical and practical issues concerning the corporation and its participants, with a particular emphasis on corporate law in practice.

• Introduction to the historical, theoretical, legal and constitutional basis of corporations and corporations legislation
  • The corporate constitution
  • Financing the corporation
  • Directors’ and officers’ duties
  • Shareholders’ remedies
  • Aspects of corporate insolvency.
ilo: Have a broad knowledge of relevant aspects of Australian corporate law
Understand contemporary issues in corporate regulation
Be able to analyse practical corporate law problems and apply principles of corporate law to them
Understand the theoretical framework for the regulation of companies.

Prerequisites.content: Students who have a degree in law from, or are admitted to practise in, Australia are not permitted to enrol in this subject except with the permission of the Associate Dean (Melbourne Law Masters).

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home
